cards.name: Skyshroud Elf
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G}.
{1}: Add {R} or {W}.
cards.flavor:
"It is our duty to endure."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.
{1}: Add {W} or {R} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Skyshroud Ranger
cards.text: {T}: You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor:
"Just as you see the grave and remember the friend, I see this forest and remember Llanowar."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

cards.originalText: {T}: Choose a land card in your hand and put it into play. Play this ability as a sorcery.

cards.name: Skyshroud Troll
cards.text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Skyshroud Troll.
cards.flavor: The elves and merfolk have nothing but bitterness for each other. The trolls, however, find them both rather tasty.
cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Regenerate Skyshroud Troll.

cards.name: Spike Drone
cards.text:
Spike Drone enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Drone: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.originalText:
Spike Drone comes into play with one +1/+1 counter on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Drone: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Storm Front
cards.text: {G}{G}: Tap target creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The calmest day on Rath would be thought a storm anywhere else.
cards.originalText: {G}{G}: Tap target creature with flying.

cards.name: Trained Armodon
cards.flavor: These are its last days. Better to grow broad and heavy. Better that the enemy is crushed beneath its carcass.

cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.
cards.flavor:
"Peace will come, but whether born of harmony or entropy I cannot say."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.name: Trumpeting Armodon
cards.text: {1}{G}: Target creature blocks Trumpeting Armodon this turn if able.
cards.flavor: These are its last days. But it will not go quietly.
cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Target creature blocks Trumpeting Armodon this turn if able.

cards.name: Verdant Force
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.flavor:
Burl, scurf, and bower
Birth fern and flower.

rulings.text: In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.
Verdant Force's ability triggers at the beginning of each upkeep, not just each of your upkeeps.

cards.originalText: During each player's upkeep, put a Saproling token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 green creature.

cards.name: Verdigris
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor:
"Only the most sophisticated inventions can survive nature's unsophisticated motivations."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Winter's Grasp
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor:
Summer is buried there, centuries deep;
A crypt of years where seasons sleep.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Aftershock
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, creature, or land. Aftershock deals 3 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"Every act of destruction has a repercussion."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact, creature, or land. Aftershock deals 3 damage to you.

cards.name: Ancient Runes
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Ancient Runes deals damage to that player equal to the number of artifacts they control.
cards.flavor: Ertai volunteered to open the portal. He figured he owed it one.
cards.originalText: During each player's upkeep, Ancient Runes deals 1 damage to that player for each artifact he or she controls.

cards.name: Apocalypse
cards.text: Exile all permanents. You discard your hand.
cards.flavor:
"There is a future in which I can see only mist and a single shadow."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.originalText: Remove all permanents from the game. Discard your hand.

cards.name: Barbed Sliver
cards.text: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
cards.flavor: Spans of spines leapt from one sliver to the next, forming a deadly hedge around the Weatherlight.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: Each Sliver gains "{2}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."

cards.name: Blood Frenzy
cards.text:
Cast this spell only before the combat damage step.
Target attacking or blocking creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
"When Torahn bellows, none survive—not even the warrior whose horns he rides."
—Talruum adage
cards.originalText: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn. At end of turn, destroy that creature.

cards.name: Boil
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.
cards.flavor:
"The fishers will throw out their nets and draw them back filled with dust."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.originalText: Destroy all islands.

cards.name: Canyon Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{1}, Discard a card at random: Canyon Drake gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "These runes are tough enough without the distraction," Ertai muttered, one eye on the drake.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}, Discard a card at random: Canyon Drake gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Canyon Wildcat
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: "Relative of yours?" Ertai teased. Mirri simply sneered.
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk (If defending player controls any mountains, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Chaotic Goo
cards.text:
Chaotic Goo enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may flip a coin. If you win the flip, put a +1/+1 counter on Chaotic Goo. If you lose the flip, remove a +1/+1 counter from Chaotic Goo.
cards.originalText:
Chaotic Goo comes into play with three +1/+1 counters on it.
During your upkeep, you may flip a coin. If you win the flip, add a +1/+1 counter to Chaotic Goo. Otherwise, remove a +1/+1 counter from it.

cards.name: Crown of Flames
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{R}: Return Crown of Flames to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: It is the forge of kings.
cards.originalText:
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{R}: Return Crown of Flames to owner's hand.

cards.name: Deadshot
cards.text: Tap target creature. It deals damage equal to its power to another target creature.
cards.flavor:
"Carrion! Keep your distance. My blade will come to you!"
—Crovax

rulings.text: Deadshot can target a creature which is already tapped as its first target, and it will still damage the second target. This is because it taps that creature as an effect, not as a cost.

cards.originalText: Tap target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to another target creature.

cards.name: Enraging Licid
cards.text:
{R}, {T}: Enraging Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {R} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature has haste.

rulings.text: Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell failing to resolve for having no legal targets.

cards.originalText: {R}, {T}: Enraging Licid loses this ability and becomes a creature enchantment that reads "Enchanted creature is unaffected by summoning sickness" instead of a creature. Move Enraging Licid onto target creature. You may pay {R} to end this effect.

cards.name: Firefly
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Firefly gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"If they don't pinch, they burn. Can't ya eat any of da bugs here?"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}: Firefly gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fireslinger
cards.text: {T}: Fireslinger deals 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"Remember the moral of the fireslinger fable: with power comes isolation."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.originalText: {T}: Fireslinger deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Flowstone Giant
cards.text: {R}: Flowstone Giant gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
When the first of these giants woke from the bedrock, he was still sleepy. He yawned and stretched until his legs grew so thin that they snapped like icicles in the sun.
—Vec lore
cards.originalText: {R}: Flowstone Giant gets +2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Flowstone Salamander
cards.text: {R}: Flowstone Salamander deals 1 damage to target creature blocking it.
cards.flavor: The Furnace of Rath is periodically illuminated by their sparkling yawns.
cards.originalText: {R}: Flowstone Salamander deals 1 damage to target creature blocking it.

cards.name: Flowstone Wyvern
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Flowstone Wyvern gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Where I come from, stone stays on the ground."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}: Flowstone Wyvern gets +2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Furnace of Rath
cards.text: If a source would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.

rulings.text: If a spell or ability damages multiple things, divide up the damage before applying this effect. This means you can't normally end up with an odd amount of damage on something.
The trample rules cause damage to be divided before it is doubled.
If you have two of these on the battlefield, the damage is multiplied by 4.
The multiplied damage counts in all ways as if it came from the original source. Furnace of Rath is not the source.

If multiple effects modify how damage will be dealt, the player who would be dealt damage or the controller of the creature that would be dealt damage chooses the order to apply the effects. For example, Mending Hands says, "Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn." Suppose a spell would deal 5 damage to a player who has cast Mending Hands targeting themselves. That player can either (a) prevent 4 damage first and then let Furnace of Rath double the remaining 1 damage, taking 2 damage, or (b) double the damage to 10 and then prevent 4 damage, taking 6 damage.

cards.originalText: Double all damage assigned to any creature or player.

cards.name: Giant Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
cards.flavor: "Crovax seems filled only with shadows," thought Orim. "Where does his strength come from?"
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

cards.name: Goblin Bombardment
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Goblin Bombardment deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: One mogg to aim the catapult, one mogg to steer the rock.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Goblin Bombardment deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Hand to Hand
cards.text: During combat, players can't cast instant spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.
cards.flavor: The match between Tahngarth and Greven was close only in the mind of the minotaur.
cards.originalText: Instants and abilities requiring an activation cost cannot be played during combat.

cards.name: Havoc
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a white spell, they lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: As Orim put the lightning rod into place on the bow, she cast a spell of protection to shield herself from the heat. That's when the Furnace got personal.

rulings.text: In a multiplayer game, it affects all opponents.

cards.originalText: Whenever target opponent successfully casts a white spell, he or she loses 2 life.

cards.name: Heart Sliver
cards.text: All Sliver creatures have haste.
cards.flavor: Gerrard looked all around for the source of the mysterious pulse, and at that moment the slivers boiled forth from the crevasses.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers are unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Jackal Pup
cards.text: Whenever Jackal Pup is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to you.
cards.flavor: The first morning after acquiring her familiar, the wizard awoke with fleabites and mange.
cards.originalText: For each 1 damage dealt to Jackal Pup, it deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Kindle
cards.text: Kindle deals X damage to any target, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Kindle in all graveyards.
cards.flavor: Hope of deliverance is scorched by the fire of futility.

rulings.text: Because Kindle is still on the stack as you perform its instructions, it isn't in your graveyard and won't add to the amount of damage dealt.

cards.originalText: Kindle deals to target creature or player an amount of damage equal to 2 plus the number of Kindle cards in all graveyards.

cards.name: Lightning Blast
cards.text: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"Those who fear the darkness have never seen what the light can do."
—Selenia, dark angel
cards.originalText: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Lightning Elemental
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: A lightning elemental once killed an entire tribe of merfolk—simply by going for a swim.
cards.originalText: Lightning Elemental is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Lowland Giant
cards.flavor: "Faugh!" snorted Tahngarth. "Why would it make a meal of something like you?" Squee looked relieved. "No," he continued, "you'd make a much better toothpick."

cards.name: Magmasaur
cards.text:
Magmasaur enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a +1/+1 counter from Magmasaur. If you don't, sacrifice Magmasaur and it deals damage equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it to each creature without flying and each player.
cards.originalText:
Magmasaur comes into play with five +1/+1 counters on it.
During your upkeep, remove a +1/+1 counter from Magmasaur, or sacrifice Magmasaur and it deals 1 damage for each +1/+1 counter on it to each creature without flying and each player.

cards.name: Mogg Conscripts
cards.text: Mogg Conscripts can't attack unless you've cast a creature spell this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Torahn's horns! They've seen us. Now, statue, you must fight to save yourself!"
—Tahngarth, aboard the Predator

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.originalText: Mogg Conscripts cannot attack unless you have successfully cast a creature spell this turn.

cards.name: Mogg Fanatic
cards.text: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: It deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: "I got it! I got it! I—"

rulings.text: Once Mogg Fanatic has dealt and been dealt combat damage, it's too late to activate its ability before it's destroyed.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: Mogg Fanatic deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Mogg Raider
cards.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The evisceration of one mogg always cheers up the rest.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Mogg Squad
cards.text: Mogg Squad gets -1/-1 for each other creature on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: As they crept into the Weatherlight's hold, the squad leader held up his hand and whispered, "Stop, goblins—what's that sound?"
cards.originalText: Mogg Squad gets -1/-1 for each other creature in play.

cards.name: No Quarter
cards.text:
Whenever a creature becomes blocked by a creature with lesser power, destroy the blocking creature.
Whenever a creature blocks a creature with lesser power, destroy the attacking creature.
cards.flavor: As Gerrard and Greven neared each other, the moggs caught between them realized they should flee.
cards.originalText: Whenever any creature blocks or is blocked by a creature with lesser power, destroy the creature with the lesser power.

cards.name: Opportunist
cards.text: {T}: Opportunist deals 1 damage to target creature that was dealt damage this turn.
cards.flavor: The third time the Oracle glanced suspiciously at him, Starke decided she had glanced twice too often.
cards.originalText: {T}: Opportunist deals 1 damage to target creature that was damaged this turn.

cards.name: Pallimud
cards.text:
As Pallimud enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Pallimud's power is equal to the number of tapped lands the chosen player controls.
cards.flavor: The old Vec tell tales of a beast that fed on scraps but turned its nose up at the lavish banquet they set in its honor.
cards.originalText: Pallimud has power equal to the number of tapped lands target opponent controls.

cards.name: Rathi Dragon
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Rathi Dragon enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice two Mountains.
cards.flavor:
Wrap the flame as twine
Kingdoms will be thine.
cards.originalText:
Flying 
When Rathi Dragon comes into play, sacrifice two mountains or sacrifice Rathi Dragon.

cards.name: Renegade Warlord
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever Renegade Warlord attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"His tongue must be honey, the way he gathers ants to fight with him."
—Volrath
cards.originalText:
First strike
If Renegade Warlord attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Rolling Thunder
cards.text: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
cards.flavor: "Such rage," thought Vhati, gazing up at the thunderhead from the Predator. "It is Greven's mind manifest."

rulings.text: If X is greater than 0, you can't choose zero targets. You must choose between one and X targets. If X is 0, you can't choose any targets.
You choose how many targets Rolling Thunder has and how the damage is divided as you cast the spell. Each target must receive at least 1 damage.

If some, but not all, of the targets become illegal by the time Rolling Thunder tries to resolve, the original division of damage still applies, but no damage is dealt to illegal targets. If all the targets are illegal, the spell won't resolve.
If Rolling Thunder is copied, the copy will retain the original damage divsion. The spell or ability will likely allow you to choose new targets, but you can't change the way damage is divided.

cards.originalText: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided any way you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Sandstone Warrior
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
{R}: Sandstone Warrior gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I used to describe something stable as 'rock solid.' So much for that expression."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText:
First strike
{R}: Sandstone Warrior gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Scorched Earth
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X land cards.
Destroy X target lands.
cards.flavor:
"Fire cleanses as well as destroys; that is the nature of change."
—Oracle en-Vec

rulings.text: X can be zero to destroy no lands.

cards.originalText: Choose and discard X land cards: Destroy X target lands.

cards.name: Searing Touch
cards.text:
Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Searing Touch deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.originalText:
Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Searing Touch deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Shadowstorm
cards.text: Shadowstorm deals 2 damage to each creature with shadow.
cards.flavor:
"You've not seen a storm until you've seen the kind that roars between worlds."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary
cards.originalText: Shadowstorm deals 2 damage to each creature with shadow.

cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor:
"Such fuss over machines, Gerrard. Remember that you are the prize of the Legacy. Throw away your toys!"
—Orim, Samite healer

rulings.text: Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Shocker
cards.text: Whenever Shocker deals damage to a player, that player discards all the cards in their hand, then draws that many cards.
cards.originalText: If Shocker damages any player, that player discards his or her hand, then draws a new hand of as many cards as he or she had before.

cards.name: Starke of Rath
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target artifact or creature. That permanent's controller gains control of Starke of Rath. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.flavor:
"I know to whom I owe the most loyalty, and I see him in the mirror every day."
—Starke
cards.originalText: {T}: Destroy target artifact or creature. That permanent's controller gains control of Starke of Rath permanently.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor:
"The land shall beg for drink and curse the rain that follows."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Stun
cards.text:
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"I concede it was a cheap shot, but it was the only one I could afford."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: Must be used before blockers are declared in order to affect blocking decisions. You can't wait to see what your opponent declares and then try to stop them.
You can use it after combat or even on a creature which can't possibly block this turn because it's that player's turn to attack, but it generally has no effect other than to let you draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Target creature cannot block this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Sudden Impact
cards.text: Sudden Impact deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
cards.flavor: The Predator roared like an unruly beast, and the Weatherlight suddenly listed. "No!" screamed Hanna.
cards.originalText: Sudden Impact deals 1 damage to target player for each card in his or her hand.

cards.name: Tahngarth's Rage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 as long as it's attacking. Otherwise, it gets -2/-1.
cards.flavor:
"Taste my horns!"
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: The effect does not receive a new timestamp when the creature goes from attacking to not attacking or the other way around.

cards.originalText: If enchanted creature is attacking, it gets +3/+0. Otherwise, it gets -2/-1.

cards.name: Tooth and Claw
cards.text: Sacrifice two creatures: Create a 3/1 red Beast creature token named Carnivore.
cards.flavor:
"You deify nature as female—kind and gentle—yet you cringe at what is natural."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Sacrifice two creatures: Put a Carnivore token into play. Treat this token as a 3/1 red creature.

cards.name: Wall of Diffusion
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Wall of Diffusion can block creatures with shadow as though Wall of Diffusion had shadow.
cards.flavor:
"The injury was being caught between this world and our own; the insult was to find walls within."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary
cards.originalText:
(Walls cannot attack.)
Wall of Diffusion can block creatures with shadow.

cards.name: Wild Wurm
cards.text: When Wild Wurm enters the battlefield, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, return Wild Wurm to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
Wurm heads appear
Wild wurm near
Wurm tails you see
Wild wurm flee
cards.originalText: When Wild Wurm comes into play, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, return Wild Wurm to owner's hand.

cards.name: Advance Scout
cards.text:
First strike
{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The soldier's path is worn smooth by the tread of many feet—all in one direction, none returning."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.originalText:
First strike
{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Angelic Protector
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Angelic Protector becomes the target of a spell or ability, Angelic Protector gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"My family sheltered in her light, the dark was content to wait."
—Crovax

rulings.text: The ability triggers when Angelic Protector is chosen as a target for a spell or ability. The Protectors ability will be put on the stack above that spell or ability, and so resolve first.

cards.originalText:
Flying
If Angelic Protector is the target of a spell or ability, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Anoint
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
cards.originalText:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.) 
Prevent up to 3 damage to any creature.

cards.name: Armored Pegasus
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"I always charge a little extra to take on a pegasus. They fly like eagles, kick like mules, and hide like hermits."
—Tahli en-Dal, bounty hunter
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Auratog
cards.text: Sacrifice an enchantment: Auratog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The auratog enjoys eating its wards.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice an enchantment: Auratog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Avenging Angel
cards.text:
Flying
When Avenging Angel dies, you may put it on top of its owner's library.

rulings.text: This has been restored as a triggered ability that triggers when it is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, rather than a replacement effect. The Angel does go to the graveyard, and will trigger any other abilities that look for this event.

cards.originalText:
Flying
If Avenging Angel is put into any graveyard from play, you may put Avenging Angel on top of owner's library.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Black
cards.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage to you from a black source. (Treat further damage from that source normally.)

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
cards.text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage to you from a blue source. (Treat further damage from that source normally.)

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Green
cards.text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage to you from a green source. (Treat further damage from that source normally.)

Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.name: Cloudchaser Eagle
cards.text:
Flying
When Cloudchaser Eagle enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor:
When the eagle catches a cloud, it tears it into strips that fall to earth.
—Vec myth of the rains

rulings.text: It destroys one of your enchantments if you are the only player with any enchantments.
Nothing happens if there are no legal enchantments to target when it enters the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Cloudchaser Eagle comes into play, destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: The swarm seemed unmoved by the artificial slivers' destruction. "They clearly were not the leaders," Hanna cursed. "I guess we'll have to do this the hard way."

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Elite Javelineer
cards.text: Whenever Elite Javelineer blocks, it deals 1 damage to target attacking creature.
cards.flavor:
"Precision is frequently more valuable than force."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: If Elite Javelineer blocks, it deals 1 damage to target attacking creature.

cards.name: Field of Souls
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

rulings.text: A creature card that you own but don't control will be put into your graveyard if that creature dies, and Field of Souls's ability will trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from play, put an Essence token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 white creature with flying.

cards.name: Flickering Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As Flickering Ward enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Enchanted creature has protection from the chosen color. This effect doesn't remove Flickering Ward.
{W}: Return Flickering Ward to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: If you choose White, the enchanted creature will have Protection from White. This will cause any other white Auras attached to that creature to be put into their owner's graveyard, but Flickering Ward will remain on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
When you play Flickering Ward, choose a color.
Enchanted creature gains protection from the chosen color.
{W}: Return Flickering Ward to owner's hand.

cards.name: Gallantry
cards.text:
Target blocking creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Forgive me," Mirri whispered. "I thought you a burden, and you saved my life." Hanna quietly accepted the apology.
cards.originalText:
Target blocking creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Gerrard's Battle Cry
cards.text: {2}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Gerrard grinned and drew his sword. "This won't be a fair fight," he called to his crew. "They should have brought a second ship!"
cards.originalText: {2}{W}: All creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Hanna's Custody
cards.text: All artifacts have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"I protect the Legacy with my life if necessary, for its purpose is far more important than my own."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
cards.originalText: Artifacts cannot be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Hero's Resolve
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+5.
cards.flavor:
"Destiny, chance, fate, fortune—they're all just ways of claiming your successes without claiming your failures."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +1/+5.

cards.name: Humility
cards.text: All creatures lose all abilities and have base power and toughness 1/1.
cards.flavor:
"One cannot cleanse the wounds of failure."
—Karn, silver golem

rulings.text: With a Humility and two Opalescences on the battlefield, if Humility has the latest timestamp, then all creatures are 1/1 with no abilities. If the timestamp order is Opalescence, Humility, Opalescence, the second Opalescence is 1/1, and the Humility and first Opalescence are 4/4. If Humility has the earliest timestamp, then everything is 4/4.
Removes all creature abilities. This includes mana abilities. Animated lands will also lose the ability to tap for mana.

This is the current interaction between Humility and Opalescence: The type-changing effect applies at layer 4, but the rest happens in the applicable layers. The rest of it will apply even if the permanent loses its ability before it's finished applying. So if Opalescence, Humility, and Worship are on the battlefield and Opalescence entered the battlefield before Humility, the following is true: Layer 4: Humility and Worship each become creatures that are still enchantments. (Opalescence). Layer 6: Humility and Worship each lose their abilities. (Humility) Layer 7b: Humility becomes 4/4 and Worship becomes 4/4. (Opalescence). Humility becomes 1/1 and Worship becomes 1/1 (Humility). But if Humility entered the battlefield before Opalescence, the following is true: Layer 4: Humility and Worship each become creatures that are still enchantments (Opalescence). Layer 6: Humility and Worship each lose their abilities (Humility). Layer 7b: Humility becomes 1/1 and Worship becomes 1/1 (Humility). Humility becomes 4/4 and Worship becomes 4/4 (Opalescence).

You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

cards.originalText: Each creature loses all abilities and is a 1/1 creature.

cards.name: Invulnerability
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Prevent all damage to you from one source. (Treat further damage from that source normally.)

First strike
{W}{W}: Knight of Dawn gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.text: Black creatures can't attack or block.

—Volrath

cards.name: Marble Titan
cards.text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.flavor:
"Strapping on nine hundred pounds of armor every morning would make any warrior cross."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Creatures with power 3 or greater do not untap during their controllers' untap phases.

cards.name: Master Decoy
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor:
"A skilled decoy can throw your enemies off your trail. A master decoy can survive to do it again."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Mounted Archers
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
{W}: Mounted Archers can block an additional creature this turn.

rulings.text: You can use the ability multiple times so it can block more than two creatures.
This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText:
Mounted Archers can block creatures with flying.
{W}: Mounted Archers can block an additional creature this turn. (All blocking assignments must still be legal.)

cards.name: Oracle en-Vec
cards.text: {T}: Target opponent chooses any number of creatures they control. During that player's next turn, the chosen creatures attack if able, and other creatures can't attack. At the beginning of that turn's end step, destroy each of the chosen creatures that didn't attack this turn. Activate this ability only during your turn.

rulings.text: The way the card works is that the target player chooses which creatures will attack on their next turn. Creatures which are chosen to attack, but do not attack, are destroyed at the end of that turn. Creatures which are not chosen to be attackers are not affected in any way other than being unable to attack.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target opponent chooses any number of creatures he or she controls. During that player's next turn, those creatures attack if able, and no other creatures can attack. At the end of that turn, destroy each of those creatures that did not attack. Use this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Orim, Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor:
"The silkworm spins itself a new existence. So the healer weaves the threads of life."
—Orim, Samite healer
cards.originalText:
Orim, Samite Healer counts as a Cleric.
{T}: Prevent up to 3 damage to any creature or player.

cards.name: Orim's Prayer
cards.text: Whenever one or more creatures attack you, you gain 1 life for each attacking creature.
cards.flavor:
"As usual, there will be time for prayer only after the worst happens."
—Orim, Samite healer

rulings.text: The ability only triggers when one or more creatures attack you. It will not trigger on creatures attacking a planeswalker you control.

cards.originalText: If any creatures attack you, gain 1 life for each attacking creature.

cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
cards.flavor: Frozen by conscience, Karn did not resist as the moggs carried him to the Predator.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature cannot attack or block.

cards.name: Pegasus Refuge
cards.text: {2}, Discard a card: Create a 1/1 white Pegasus creature token with flying.
cards.flavor:
The first Rath-born pegasus was so offended by the sky that it hid its eyes in the earth.

cards.originalText: {2}, Choose and discard a card: Put a Pegasus token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 white creature with flying.

cards.name: Quickening Licid
cards.text:
{1}{W}, {T}: Quickening Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {W} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature has first strike.

rulings.text: Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell failing to resolve for having no legal targets.

cards.originalText: {1}{W}, {T}: Quickening Licid loses this ability and becomes a creature enchantment that reads "Enchanted creature gains first strike" instead of a creature. Move Quickening Licid onto target creature. You may pay {W} to end this effect.

cards.name: Repentance
cards.text: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.
cards.flavor:
"The cannon wasn't aimed at you!" pleaded Vhati.
"I'm not sure which is more pathetic," replied Greven, "your judgment or your aim."
cards.originalText: Target creature deals to itself damage equal to its power.
